the 18<sup>th<\sup>, & then it gradually fell to 28c36 
as I said. The Winds, for the most part, were 
in some Westerly Point, till Jan.11, & then SE<sup>2<\sup>, 
with Fair, & an Hard Frost for a week; 
the Weather, before the 11<sup>th<\sup>, being Cloudy and 
Moist, w<sup>th<\sup> some Snow now & then, &  little Rain 
on Jan.5. All the rest of Jan. was, for y<sup>e<\sup> 
most part, Cloudy w<sup>th<\sup> Snow, & but little 
Fair, & y<sup>t<\sup> attended w<sup>th<\sup> Frost. 
In <u>Feb<\u>. the Barometer continued 
high, untill, by a gradual Descent, it came 
to 28c98 on Feb. 15 & 17, Wind Westerly 3 & 
4. Likewise on Feb. 25, it fell to 28c28, 
Wind W<sup>4<\sup>. The greatest part of this Month, 
the Weather was Cloudy, & sometimes w<sup>th<\sup> 
thick Darkness, frequent Snow, & now 
& then Fair with sharp Frost. 
All <u>March<\u> the Barometer was above 
29 inches, sometimes above 30. The greatest 
part of the month was Cloudy, w<sup>th<\sup> frequent 
Snow, & some Fair w<sup>th<\sup> sharp Frosts: the Winds 
were Variable, & their strength about 1 & 2 
degrees
